heading: Which EU countries restrict or ban abortion?
subheading: Eleven countries impose procedural or legal barriers to accessing abortion, such as waiting periods or compulsory consultations. However, most of these countries provide care on demand.
legend1: No waiting periods or compulsory counselling for abortion care. Abortion care on request.
textNote: Abortion is totally banned in Malta and highly restrictive in Poland.
extraInfoText_BE: Waiting period of 6 days and compulsory counseling
extraInfoText_DE: Waiting period of 3 days and compulsory counseling
extraInfoText_HU: Waiting period of 3 days and compulsory counseling
extraInfoText_IT: Waiting period of 3 days and compulsory counseling
extraInfoText_PL: Abortion is only allowed if a womanâ€™s life or health is at risk, the pregnancy is the result of sexual assault or involves a severe fetal anomaly.
extraInfoText_SK: Waiting period of 4 days and compulsory counseling
